questions.question: You are ............................ a nuisance.
questions.description: We can use quite or rather before an article + singular countable noun.

questions.question: The film was ..................................
questions.description: We use rather before article + singular countable noun.

questions.question: ...................................... a singer is he?
questions.description: Before a singular countable noun we can use a quantifier with of.

questions.question: I think he is .................................
questions.description: We can use a quantifier with of before a singular countable noun.

questions.question: She is ................................ politician than an activist.
He is .............................. an intellectual.
questions.description: We can use a quantifier with of before a singular countable noun.  A lot is not used in the structure.

questions.question: ............................. do you want a holiday?
questions.description: Questions about degree are asked with how much.

questions.question: You made ................................ mistakes.
questions.description: Quite a few has a similar meaning to rather a lot.

questions.question: We met ............................. people who spoke German.
questions.description: We use few with countable nouns we use little with uncountable noun.

questions.question: I ate ................................ meat.
questions.description: Too much can be modified by much and rather.

questions.question: We do ............................. of business in China.
questions.description: A lot can be modified by quite and rather.
